page.title: 19THE HALKETTS OF PITFIRRANE
page.content: The Halkett Family of Pitfirrane has been associated with estates of that name as far back as the earliest written records exist, the 14th century. The first named of any of the family was a Robert Halkett, appointed sheriff of Kinross by Robert 2nd in 1360, and he has been followed by many distinguished ancestors, including John Halkett, killed at the battle of Pinkie in September 1547, Sir Arthur Halkett Bart., and Wedder Conway Halkett, Sir Arthur's only son, who died of illness on the Nile expedition of 1885. The last of the family was Miss Madeleine Halkett, and on her death the mansion house and the grounds of the Pitfirrane estate were purchased by the Dunfermline Carnegie Trust, and then leased to Dunfermline Golf Club. (see page 18)
